treks.name: Valley of Flowers Trek
treks.quick_version: UNESCO site with 500+ alpine flowers, July-Sept bloom, combine with Hemkund Sahib.
treks.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site famous for endemic alpine flowers. Trek through Himalayan meadows carpeted with over 500 species of wildflowers. Combine with Hemkund Sahib pilgrimage. Stunning mountain backdrops including Nanda Devi.
safety_tips: No camping in valley - stay at base
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Valley only accessible July-Sept when flowers bloom. Outside this period, valley closed or flowers absent. Many try visiting June or October and find it closed.

treks.name: Chadar Trek
treks.quick_version: Walk on frozen Zanskar River, -30°C, January-February only, extreme difficulty.
treks.best_season: January to February (only when Zanskar River freezes)
treks.description: Walk on frozen Zanskar River - one of world's most unique treks. Experience sub-zero temperatures, frozen waterfalls, and dramatic gorges. Sleep in caves. Challenging winter Himalayan adventure requiring mental and physical toughness.
safety_tips: Ice can crack - follow guide precisely
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Many underestimate extreme cold. -30°C is life-threatening if unprepared. Also, river freezing unpredictable - some years trek cancelled. Book with cancellation insurance.

treks.name: Roopkund Trek
treks.quick_version: Mystery skeleton lake at 5000m, ancient human remains, challenging high-altitude.
treks.best_season: May to June, September to October
treks.description: Mystery lake with hundreds of ancient human skeletons visible when ice melts. Trek through oak forests, alpine meadows, and glacial terrain. Summit rewards with Trishul and Nanda Ghunti views. Archaeological intrigue combined with challenging high-altitude trekking.
safety_tips: Skeleton Lake protected - don't disturb remains
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Skeletons visible only when ice melts (late May-June). September-October has fresh snow covering them. Choose timing based on whether you want to see skeletons.

treks.name: Sandakphu Trek
treks.quick_version: View 4 of world's 5 tallest peaks including Everest, Kanchenjunga, Lhotse, Makalu.
treks.best_season: October to December, March to May
treks.description: Highest peak in West Bengal offering views of four of world's five tallest peaks: Everest, Kanchenjunga, Lhotse, and Makalu. Trek through rhododendron forests, Sherpa villages, and along India-Nepal border. Stunning sunrise views.
safety_tips: Water sources limited in some sections
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Best views during clear weather (Oct-Dec, Mar-May). Monsoon (June-Sept) has zero visibility with clouds. Don't trek during monsoon expecting mountain views.

treks.name: Hampta Pass Trek
treks.quick_version: Cross from green Kullu to barren Lahaul, dramatic landscape shift, Chandratal Lake.
treks.effort_level: Moderate - good for beginners to high altitude
treks.description: Cross from lush Kullu Valley to barren Lahaul region. Experience dramatic landscape transition, pristine Chandratal Lake, glacial streams, and mountain passes. Excellent trek for first-time high-altitude trekkers.
safety_tips: River crossings can be challenging during monsoon
Hampta Pass ascent steep - start early
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Chandratal Lake side trip adds 1-2 days. Many don't plan for this and miss the stunning lake. Include it in your itinerary.

treks.name: Goechala Trek
treks.quick_version: Close-up Kanchenjunga (3rd highest peak), 15+ Himalayan peaks, pristine Sikkim forests.
treks.best_season: April to May, October to November
treks.description: Get up-close with Kanchenjunga, third highest peak in world. Trek through pristine Sikkim forests, high-altitude lakes, and rhododendron valleys. View 15+ Himalayan peaks from viewpoint. Protected national park with rich biodiversity.
safety_tips: Early morning summit attempt for clear views
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Sikkim permits take time - apply 2-3 months advance through registered agency. Individual trekkers not allowed - must join organized group.

treks.name: Markha Valley Trek
treks.quick_version: Remote Ladakhi villages, monasteries, snow leopard territory, Kongmaru La pass.
treks.description: Classic Ladakh trek through remote villages, ancient monasteries, and high mountain passes. Experience authentic Ladakhi culture, spot snow leopards (if lucky), cross dramatic gorges. Kongmaru La pass crossing most challenging section.
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Leh acclimatization minimum 3 days non-negotiable. Many rush to start trek and face severe altitude sickness. Rest properly in Leh first.

treks.name: Dzongri Trek
treks.quick_version: Kanchenjunga views without extreme difficulty, rhododendron forests, Lepcha culture.
treks.best_season: April to May, September to November
treks.description: Spectacular views of Kanchenjunga massif without extreme difficulty. Trek through Khangchendzonga National Park, rhododendron forests, alpine meadows. Sunrise from Dzongri Top mesmerizing. Cultural interactions with Lepcha communities.
safety_tips: Permit mandatory - arrange through registered agency
treks.avoid_common_mistake: April-May rhododendron bloom is spectacular but many miss it by trekking other months. Time your trek for flower season if possible.

treks.name: Pin Parvati Pass Trek
treks.quick_version: India's toughest trek, glacier crossing, technical climbing, mountaineering experience required.
treks.description: One of India's toughest treks connecting lush Parvati Valley to cold desert Spiti. Cross glacier, navigate crevasses, experience extreme altitude. For experienced mountaineers only. Requires technical skills and excellent fitness.
treks.avoid_common_mistake: This is NOT a regular trek - it's technical mountaineering. Many regular trekkers attempt without skills and face life-threatening situations. Only for experienced mountaineers.
treks.estimated_cost: ₹40,000-60,000 due to technical nature and safety requirements

treks.name: Kuari Pass Trek
treks.quick_version: Lord Curzon's trail, beginner-friendly, panoramic Himalayan views, ideal first trek.
treks.effort_level: Easy to Moderate - perfect for beginners
treks.best_season: April to June, September to November
treks.description: Lord Curzon's Trail offering panoramic views of Nanda Devi, Kamet, Dronagiri, and Chaukhamba peaks. Beginner-friendly high-altitude trek through oak forests and meadows. Perfect introduction to Himalayan trekking.
treks.avoid_common_mistake: Though beginner-friendly, it's still high altitude (3800m). Some fitness and acclimatization needed. Not a casual walk. Prepare physically.
